wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Philip   (22 May 1858 – 21 January 1932) was a Scottish solicitor and campaigner for calendar reform.  He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh in 1913

response: *Alexander Philip (1858–1932), a lawyer born in Portobello, became a campaigner for calendar reform

link_mentions.page: History of taxation in the United Kingdom
response: An alternative explanation of the origin of the tax year is still found on some British tax websites. This stems from a book published in 1921 by Alexander Philip. The relevant passage is short:
